abstract: Apple’s advances in the e-book market are not as impressive as they sound, but could prove trouble for Amazon down the road.
snippet: Apple’s advances in the e-book market are not as impressive as they sound, but could prove trouble for Amazon down the road.
lead_paragraph: There was e-book news on Monday at Apple’s Worldwide Developers Conference: Steven P. Jobs, Apple’s chief executive, said that big publishers had told him that sales of e-books for the iPad now accounted for 22 percent of all e-book sales.

headline.main: Why Apple’s iBooks Numbers Are Meaningless
